abstract.t: This memo describes SIV, a block cipher mode of operation. SIV takes a key, a plaintext, and multiple variable-length octet strings which will be authenticated but not encrypted. It produces a ciphertext having the same length as the plaintext and a synthetic initialization vector. Depending on how it is used, SIV achieves either the goal of deterministic authenticated-encryption or the goal of nonce-based, misuse-resistant authenticated-encryption.
